node.title: Ford and Rivian no longer plan to work jointly on electric vehicles.
node.alt: Workers at the Rivian factory in Normal, Ill., this year.
node.description: Ford remains an investor, but its own E.V. development plans have progressed since the partnership was announced.
node.content: ["Ford Motor and Rivian have dropped plans to develop an electric vehicle together, although Ford remains a major investor in the start-up automaker.", "The companies formed a partnership in 2019 when Ford invested $500 million in Rivian. They originally envisioned working closely on electric vehicles, but Ford discarded a plan to use Rivian\u2019s chassis for an electric model for its Lincoln brand while saying they still intended to cooperate. On Friday, the companies said collaboration was no longer in prospect.", "\u201cAs Ford has scaled its own E.V. strategy and demand for Rivian vehicles has grown, we\u2019ve mutually decided to focus on our own projects and deliveries,\u201d Rivian said in a statement. \u201cOur relationship with Ford is an important part of our journey, and Ford remains an investor and ally on our shared path to an electrified future.\u201d", "The change in plans was reported earlier by Automotive News, based on an interview with Ford's chief executive, Jim Farley.", "Since its investment in Rivian, Ford has started rolling out electric models of its own. The Mustang Mach E, a sport utility vehicle, has drawn favorable comparisons to competing models from Tesla. Ford is expected to start making a battery-powered version of its F-150 pickup next year, and it has taken tens of thousands of orders from customers.", "\u201cWe respect Rivian and have had extensive exploratory discussions with them,\u201d Ford said in a statement. \u201cHowever, both sides have agreed not to pursue any kind of joint vehicle development or platform sharing.\u201d", "After an initial public offering of stock this month, Rivian has a market value of nearly $115 billion, significantly more than Ford\u2019s valuation of $77 billion. Rivian has just started production of an electric pickup and an electric S.U.V., and has delivered only a small number to customers so far.", "Ford\u2019s holding in Rivian amounts to about a 12 percent stake.", "Rivian is working on an electric delivery van for Amazon, another major investor."]
